body_html:
I'm getting a similar error, below.

I have a GeForce GTX 1080 (hence the 6.1 compute capability), CUDA 8.0.27.1 (the 8.0 RC with patch), cuDNN 5.1.5-1.

$ ./configure
~/src/tensorflow ~/src/tensorflow
Please specify the location of python. [Default is /home/xpe/anaconda3/bin/python]: 
Do you wish to build TensorFlow with Google Cloud Platform support? [y/N] 
No Google Cloud Platform support will be enabled for TensorFlow
Found possible Python library paths:
  /home/xpe/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages
Please input the desired Python library path to use.  Default is [/home/xpe/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages]

/home/xpe/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages
Do you wish to build TensorFlow with GPU support? [y/N] y
GPU support will be enabled for TensorFlow
Please specify which gcc should be used by nvcc as the host compiler. [Default is /usr/bin/gcc]: 
Please specify the Cuda SDK version you want to use, e.g. 7.0. [Leave empty to use system default]: 
Please specify the location where CUDA  toolkit is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]: 
Please specify the Cudnn version you want to use. [Leave empty to use system default]: 
Please specify the location where cuDNN  library is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]: 
Invalid path to cuDNN  toolkit. Neither of the following two files can be found:
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/libcudnn.so

Please specify the Cudnn version you want to use. [Leave empty to use system default]:  
Please specify the location where cuDNN  library is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]: 
Please specify a list of comma-separated Cuda compute capabilities you want to build with.
You can find the compute capability of your device at: https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-gpus.
Please note that each additional compute capability significantly increases your build time and binary size.
[Default is: "3.5,5.2"]: 6.1
Extracting Bazel installation...
.
INFO: Starting clean (this may take a while). Consider using --expunge_async if the clean takes more than several minutes.
.
ERROR: /home/xpe/.cache/bazel/_bazel_xpe/641dfc594d651643762f515addd22118/external/protobuf/protobuf.bzl:91:19: name 'HOST_CFG' is not defined.
ERROR: package contains errors: tensorflow/tools/proto_text.
ERROR: error loading package 'tensorflow/tools/proto_text': Extension 'protobuf.bzl' has errors.
Configuration finished
body_text:
I'm getting a similar error, below.
I have a GeForce GTX 1080 (hence the 6.1 compute capability), CUDA 8.0.27.1 (the 8.0 RC with patch), cuDNN 5.1.5-1.
$ ./configure
~/src/tensorflow ~/src/tensorflow
Please specify the location of python. [Default is /home/xpe/anaconda3/bin/python]: 
Do you wish to build TensorFlow with Google Cloud Platform support? [y/N] 
No Google Cloud Platform support will be enabled for TensorFlow
Found possible Python library paths:
  /home/xpe/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages
Please input the desired Python library path to use.  Default is [/home/xpe/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages]

/home/xpe/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages
Do you wish to build TensorFlow with GPU support? [y/N] y
GPU support will be enabled for TensorFlow
Please specify which gcc should be used by nvcc as the host compiler. [Default is /usr/bin/gcc]: 
Please specify the Cuda SDK version you want to use, e.g. 7.0. [Leave empty to use system default]: 
Please specify the location where CUDA  toolkit is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]: 
Please specify the Cudnn version you want to use. [Leave empty to use system default]: 
Please specify the location where cuDNN  library is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]: 
Invalid path to cuDNN  toolkit. Neither of the following two files can be found:
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/libcudnn.so

Please specify the Cudnn version you want to use. [Leave empty to use system default]:  
Please specify the location where cuDNN  library is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]: 
Please specify a list of comma-separated Cuda compute capabilities you want to build with.
You can find the compute capability of your device at: https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-gpus.
Please note that each additional compute capability significantly increases your build time and binary size.
[Default is: "3.5,5.2"]: 6.1
Extracting Bazel installation...
.
INFO: Starting clean (this may take a while). Consider using --expunge_async if the clean takes more than several minutes.
.
ERROR: /home/xpe/.cache/bazel/_bazel_xpe/641dfc594d651643762f515addd22118/external/protobuf/protobuf.bzl:91:19: name 'HOST_CFG' is not defined.
ERROR: package contains errors: tensorflow/tools/proto_text.
ERROR: error loading package 'tensorflow/tools/proto_text': Extension 'protobuf.bzl' has errors.
Configuration finished
body:
I'm getting a similar error, below.

I have a GeForce GTX 1080 (hence the 6.1 compute capability), CUDA 8.0.27.1 (the 8.0 RC with patch), cuDNN 5.1.5-1.

```
$ ./configure
~/src/tensorflow ~/src/tensorflow
Please specify the location of python. [Default is /home/xpe/anaconda3/bin/python]: 
Do you wish to build TensorFlow with Google Cloud Platform support? [y/N] 
No Google Cloud Platform support will be enabled for TensorFlow
Found possible Python library paths:
  /home/xpe/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages
Please input the desired Python library path to use.  Default is [/home/xpe/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages]

/home/xpe/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages
Do you wish to build TensorFlow with GPU support? [y/N] y
GPU support will be enabled for TensorFlow
Please specify which gcc should be used by nvcc as the host compiler. [Default is /usr/bin/gcc]: 
Please specify the Cuda SDK version you want to use, e.g. 7.0. [Leave empty to use system default]: 
Please specify the location where CUDA  toolkit is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]: 
Please specify the Cudnn version you want to use. [Leave empty to use system default]: 
Please specify the location where cuDNN  library is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]: 
Invalid path to cuDNN  toolkit. Neither of the following two files can be found:
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/lib64/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-8.0/libcudnn.so

Please specify the Cudnn version you want to use. [Leave empty to use system default]:  
Please specify the location where cuDNN  library is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]: 
Please specify a list of comma-separated Cuda compute capabilities you want to build with.
You can find the compute capability of your device at: https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-gpus.
Please note that each additional compute capability significantly increases your build time and binary size.
[Default is: "3.5,5.2"]: 6.1
Extracting Bazel installation...
.
INFO: Starting clean (this may take a while). Consider using --expunge_async if the clean takes more than several minutes.
.
ERROR: /home/xpe/.cache/bazel/_bazel_xpe/641dfc594d651643762f515addd22118/external/protobuf/protobuf.bzl:91:19: name 'HOST_CFG' is not defined.
ERROR: package contains errors: tensorflow/tools/proto_text.
ERROR: error loading package 'tensorflow/tools/proto_text': Extension 'protobuf.bzl' has errors.
Configuration finished
```
